items.content_html: Best part of the Mythos theme on micro.blog? Titleless posts that are longer than 300 characters. Praise be!

items.content_html: I really, really hate when I hear the phrase “do no harm” in relation to care from the medical field when in fact many times harm needs to be done to help the patient (not to mention it’s not part of the original Hippocratic Oath…)
items.content_text: I really, really hate when I hear the phrase "do no harm" in relation to care from the medical field when in fact many times harm needs to be done to help the patient (not to mention it's not part of the original Hippocratic Oath...)

items.content_html:
The new coffee subscription offerings from Counter Culture showed up today…

The Jabanto smelled like a blueberry muffin when I squeezed the bag so it definitely lived up to the notes â€” at least on a squeeze. Very fruity! Looking forward to trying the Gundikhan tomorrow morning. Not sure if Iâ€™ve had beans from India as of yet.

items.content_html: Further, the issue I’m having with Ghost is that all of the themes are too “Ghosty”.
items.content_text: Further, the issue I'm having with Ghost is that **all** of the themes are too "Ghosty".

items.content_html: Really like the look of Matt Langford’s Mythos theme. It looks good and is simple. It reminds me how much I am not liking my Ghost setup which is too…Ghosty…for what I want.
items.content_text: Really like the look of Matt Langford's Mythos theme. It looks good and is simple. It reminds me how much I am not liking my Ghost setup which is too...Ghosty...for what I want.

items.content_html: So at one point it was impossible to find a USB-C hub that was solely USB-C unless you wanted to pay a fortune for something like a OWC dock. Now they seem to be available from Belkin and Anker (maybe others). It’s about time.
items.content_text: So at one point it was impossible to find a USB-C hub that was solely USB-C unless you wanted to pay a fortune for something like a OWC dock. Now they seem to be available from Belkin and Anker (maybe others). It's about time.

items.content_html: Excited to see that Automattic has released a web clipper for Day One. Currently available for Firefox/Chrome. Hoping a Safari version is in the works. dayoneapp.com/releases/…

items.content_html: Love my kids more than anything but very happy my son is now back at college and our small house has one fewer adult in it. Our house is a tiny WW2-era Cape Cod and it not designed for 4 adults ðŸ˜†. Next stop January when my daughter moves out…
